Maduro now in New York jail as Trump says US to 'run' Venezuela
Subhead: Nicolas Maduro arrived at a New York jail on Saturday, hours after he and his wife were seized by US special forces. The couple is to be arraigned on drug trafficking and weapons charges.

Title: The kingdom of the 'shamassa,' Sudan's children of war
Subhead: 'War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation' (4/6) 'Shamassa' means 'child of the sun,' but these street children wear the name poorly. Turned into easy prey by the conflict, the orphans live at the mercy of armed groups, telling the story of war through a child's eyes.

Title: French managers of Swiss bar face criminal probe after fire
Subhead: The two owners of Le Constellation bar at the Swiss resort of Crans-Montana said that they followed all safety norms.

Title: Behind Victor Wembanyama, the NBA's Frenchmen have mixed fortunes
Subhead: Nineteen French players are currently competing in the NBA. While the San Antonio Spurs star commands most of the spotlight, the new generation is striving to find its place in an intensely competitive environment.

Title: Stéphane Viville, researcher: 'For infertility, the first line of prevention is political and educational'
Subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the biologist and geneticist discusses the advances in assisted reproductive technology and the need to implement awareness and protection policies against certain pollutants.

Poland's iconic 1989 round table consigned to museum
Subhead: This symbolic piece of furniture, on which communist leaders and democratic activists reached agreement, is leaving the presidential palace. The decision by nationalist President Karol Nawrocki is sparking debate in the country.

Title: They cook organic, distrust science and oppose vaccines: America's 'crunchy moms' shift toward Trump
Subhead: In the 1960s, the 'crunchy mom' was typically an American hippie trying to stay connected to nature. Today, she claims total freedom over health decisions, sometimes flirting with conspiracy theories.

Title: Russia unleashes mass plunder of Ukrainian homes in occupied areas
Subhead: A law signed by Vladimir Putin on December 15, 2025, encourages large-scale expropriation of property owners in areas occupied by the Russian army. Kyiv condemns the move as 'population replacement.'
